author: Wiktor Szary
title: U.K. Condemns ‘Brazen’ Attempted Murder of Russian Double Agent
text:
LONDON—British Home Secretary Amber Rudd said the U.K. would be ready to respond to the attempted murder of a Russian double agent living in Britain if it was attributed to Moscow, describing the use of a nerve agent on U.K. soil as a “brazen and reckless act.”
“We know exactly what we’re doing,” Ms. Rudd told the British Broadcasting Corp. Thursday. “We’re going to be waiting for the evidence, when we have it, if we attribute, we will have a plan.”
